name: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl 2-methoxybenzoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1123
Reason: 4-{(2E)-3-[4-(dimethylamino)phenyl]prop-2-enoyl}phenyl has a melting point influenced by the functional groups in the molecule relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The dimethylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The prop-2-enoyl group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in dipole interactions and increase the melting point by approximately +30°C.
